text: Al-Hilal Saudi Football Club (; The Crescent), also known simply as Al-Hilal, is a professional Saudi Arabian football team from Riyadh. With 55 total titles, they are the most successful club in Asia. ==History== Al Hilal SFC was founded on 1957 and Saudi Arabian club, Al Hilal SFC plays home games in Kingdom Arena in Riyadh. Al Hilal SFC won in the 1960-1961 seasons in the Saudi Cup Trophies, it won in the 1976-77 title in the Saudi League. On March 2024, they broke world record with 28 wins in Saudi Professional League. ==Players== ==Honours== ===Domestic Competitions=== *Saudi Professional League ** (19) : 1977, 1979, 1985, 1986, 1988, 1990, 1996, 1998, 2002, 2005, 2008, 2010, 2011, 2017, 2018, 2020, 2021, 2022, 2024 **(Record) ** (14) : 1980, 1981, 1983, 1987, 1993, 1995, 1997, 2006, 2007, 2009, 2013, 2014, 2016, 2019 * Saudi King's cup ** (13) : 1961, 1964, 1980, 1982, 1984, 1989, 2015, 2017, 2020, 2021, 2022, 2024 ** (8) : 1963, 1968, 1977, 1981, 1985, 1987, 2010, 2023 * Crown Prince Cup ** (13) : 1964, 1995, 2000, 2003, 2005, 2006, 2008, 2009, 2010, 2011, 2012, 2013, 2016 (Record) ** (4) : 1957, 1998, 2014, 2015 * Saudi Federation cup Known as (Prince Faisal Bin Fahad Cup) ** (7) : 1987, 1990, 1993, 1996, 2000, 2005, 2006 (Record) ** (5) : 1986, 2002, 2003, 2008, 2010 * Saudi Founder's Cup ** (1) : 2000 ===Asia=== * AFC Champions League ** (3) : 1991, 2000, 2019 ** (4) : 1986, 1987, 2014, 2017 * Asian Cup Winners' Cup ** (2) : 1997, 2002 * Asian Super Cup ** (2) : 1997, 2000 ===Arabian Gulf=== * Arabian Gulf Club Champions Cup ** (2) : 1986, 1998 ** (3) : 1987, 1992, 2000 ===Other=== * Saudi-Egyptian Super Cup ** (1) : 2001 == References == == Other websites == * * * * * Category:Saudi Arabian football clubs Category:Riyadh Category:1957 establishments in Asia Category:1950s establishments in Saudi Arabia Category:Al Hilal SFC
title: Al Hilal SFC
